Metro Diner Augusta, GA Where Classic Southern Charm Meets Classic Southern Diner Food 
If you‚Äôre hungry for savory, home-style comfort food in the Augusta, GA, area, look no further than Metro Diner! Wondering what to expect from this award-winning restaurant in downtown Augusta? This much is guaranteed:¬† a warm welcome; a hearty plate of some of the you‚Äôve ever tasted. Our Augusta location stays true to our humble roots with must-try signature items like Fried Chicken & Waffles and our famous Iron City Meatloaf (as featured on Guy Fieri‚Äôs ).
best comfort food Diners, Drive-ins and Dives 
Located on Washington Road, near I-20 (Carl Sanders Highway), Metro Diner Augusta is less than a mile from Augusta National Golf Club and minutes from Augusta University ‚Äì Summerville Campus, Augusta Mall and the Medical District.¬† It‚Äôs the perfect place to grab a bite to eat on your way into beautiful downtown Augusta to for a show at James Brown Arena or after exploring the Augusta Riverwalk.

And about that Southern hospitality? You‚Äôll find an extra helping here at Metro Diner, where regulars and newcomers alike are welcomed like special guests in our home. Know that a warm smile comes along with every glass of sweet tea, cup of strong coffee and delicious .
breakfast, lunch and dinner

Here on the banks of the Savannah River, Georgia‚Äôs second-oldest city is home to beautiful parks as well as unique shops, attractions and museums including the Augusta Museum of History ‚Äì check out popular exhibits featuring two Augusta originals, singer James Brown and the
Masters Golf Tournament. 
And if you‚Äôre here in April, you can experience the energy and excitement of the Masters Tournament for yourself, when golf fans from all over come to see the top golfers in the world!

Just a few of the great places to visit in Augusta:

Augusta National Golf Club

Augusta Mall ‚Äì Riverwalk

Augusta ‚Äì Morris Museum of Art

Sacred Heart Cultural Center

Meadow Garden

James Brown Arena

SRP Stadium

Riverwatch Luxury Cinema

Before or after you explore Augusta, may we suggest ? Come on by Washington Road for Fried Chicken & Waffles, Biscuits & Sausage Gravy, Avocado Toast, Classic Egg Benedict and more. Don‚Äôt forget the mimosas and Bloody Mary‚Äôs. Now we‚Äôre talking about a great day.
Metro Diner Brunch Discover Atlanta‚Äôs Kid-Friendly Adventures And Metro Diner Family Meals to Go 
For the little ones, don‚Äôt miss a trip to one or more of Augusta‚Äôs great parks! Try Phinizy Swamp Nature Park, Living History Park, Pendleton King Park, Brick Bond Park or many more green spaces rich with history and the great outdoors.

A picnic always makes a day more fun, and you can order ! We offer home and office delivery or try our contactless pick up ‚Äì either way, its family-friendly dining made easy.
Metro Diner for breakfast, lunch and dinner to-go 
features Chicken Tenders, a lil‚Äô short stack of Pancakes, Belgian Waffles dusted with powdered sugar or a mini portion of Chicken & Waffles. Scratch-made, kid approved. Or try our Metro Diner Family Dinners like the Bissell Platter for 4 with scrambled eggs, bacon, toast, hashbrowns or grits and pancakes, a Boneless Wing Pack with dipping sauce or even our Iron City Meatloaf for 4 with creamy mashed potatoes and green beans.
The Metro Diner Kids‚Äô Menu 
While we‚Äôre talking food to go, don‚Äôt forget ! Corporate event catering, graduation catering, business lunches, family reunions, you name it, we‚Äôll bring over tasty homestyle cooking for everyone. Your team or guests won‚Äôt be disappointed by crispy Fish & Chips, triple layer Club Sandwiches or Charleston Shrimp & Grits for a crowd.

What to order at Metro Diner? When in Charleston, go with the Charleston Shrimp & Grits, of course! First, we make our grits good and cheesy then infuse ‚Äòem with roasted red peppers and andouille sausage. Next, we fry them to a golden crisp, top with tender shrimp simmered in a peppery sauce, and finish with crisp bacon crumbles. Mmmm.

Located at the corner of Sam Rittenberg Blvd and Ashely River Road in the Westwood Plaza Shopping Center, Metro Diner West Ashley- Charleston is just a mile from the Cultural Arts Center of Charleston and near the College of Charleston and The Citadel. It‚Äôs also the perfect place for delicious before or after shopping at the Tanger Outlets, catching a Charleston RiverDogs or Battery‚Äôs game, or after visiting the Fort Sumter National Monument.
breakfast, lunch or dinner

Travel + Leisure 
Charleston receives high marks for historic preservation and hospitality, so start by heading to historic downtown, or ‚ÄúDowntown Chuck,‚Äù where you can take it all in at your own pace. There‚Äôs no wrong way to see Charleston, but the Old South Historic Horse & Carriage Tour is a great option to see the city and snap some incredible photos.

If you‚Äôre around in the spring, head to the stunning to catch the magnolias in bloom. Bring your family, or maybe a sweetheart, after all, andcall Charleston the most romantic city in the U.S.

guest favorites Excursions for Kids and Kids-at-Heart And Family Meals to Go

Our has kid-sized portions of our Fried Chicken & Waffles, as well as Chicken Tenders, Belgian Waffles, and plenty more to please even your pickiest l‚Äôil eaters. You can also order Metro Diner including Iron City Meat Loaf or Fried Chicken for Four, Boneless Wing Packs and more!
